title: Hierarchical Training System Design for Shelter Dog Training and Adoption Rate Improvement

context.prior_knowledge: Basic ethology, shelter management experience, and training program design knowledge
context.additional_context: Learners are primarily pet-related business managers or animal welfare organization leaders, with a focus on practical training system design. Hybrid online/offline activities are conducted in a BYOD environment.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the three-tiered (basic/intermediate/advanced) components of a hierarchical training system.
Learners can apply customized training techniques for specific problem behaviors (e.g., canine aggression, excessive excitement).
Learners can design training performance metrics (e.g., reduced average shelter stay, increased adoption application rates) to improve adoption rates.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
